website_summaries.verdict: Easy Heat provides a quality cable for a low cost.
pros: Cable is strong and sturdy while remaining flexible enough for easy installation
The auto on and off thermostat works safely and effectively
Installation instructions are clear and simple to follow
Quality of the cable is not affected by the low cost
cons: Cable will overheat if 2 sections of the cable are overlapped
Install the cable in a straight line

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping RV water hose from freezing.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Heat I've used to keep my RV water hose flowing. So far this winter we have had four days straight with the temp getting down to 7 and only getting up to 22. The line has kept the water hose from freezing up just fine. I have the heat line taped to the water hose with elec. tape, then wrapped foam pipe wrapping around this. Then duct taped the foam so it would stay sealed and help with a little more insulation. I know this is not what this is designed for, but it does the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Camper John

customer_reviews.title: The pipe needs to be the length of the heater ...
customer_reviews.text: The pipe needs to be the length of the heater or longer. It can't be installed on both sides of the pipe to use up the extra if the pipe is too short and it can't be wound around the pipe to use up the excess. The directions state these type installations could be a fire hazard. If you have a 2 foot pipe don't purchase a 3 foot heater.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the insulation parts too!
customer_reviews.text: Came just in time for a period in single degrees likely to try our water line, but they didn't mention that you need special tape and insulation to use this properly, so I can't install it for another week or so. Needed materials should be included or noted.
customer_reviews.author: redfox

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Since we live in an RV in PA I needed something to keep our water supply hose from freezing. I used this thermostatically-controlled heat tape along with swimming noodles (1" inside diameter hole to fit the hose and heat tape in bought from a dollar store - NOTE: Noodles were slit down one side and fitted over the heat tape and hose, then slit was taped over with electrical tape). Temps dropped to 9 degrees F and our water supply line never froze up. Also we noticed little impact on our electric bill since during warmer weather the thermostat worked as advertised - shut down the heat when the temp of the hose rose above 45 degrees F.
customer_reviews.author: Sci-Fi Guy

customer_reviews.title: I bought this heater tape to use on an outside ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heater tape to use on an outside water valve during the winter. While I have an indoor shutoff, it leaks a little and because it's above a finished ceiling, I'd have to cut a hole in plaster to replace it. This tape allows me to keep the outside valve warm enough that it doesn't freeze. Several years ago, I heard water running on a Sunday afternoon and found that the exposed water valve split open outside in -5 degree temperatures. Water was shooting 10 feet across my yard. What a mess.. Won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: BP Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very good pipe heater
customer_reviews.text: I have this installed on a 1" PVC pipe under my mobile home. You have to wrap plastic pipe with aluminum foil before you install the cable. High-quality electrical tape every 6-8". I used foam duct wrap over everything. The sensor has to be in contact with the pipe. So far it has protected down to 5°F, with a wind chill at least 10° lower. The lighted plug shows if it has power, not if it's heating. It is supposed to be plugged into a GFCI outlet. It has only been installed for a month, so I can't speak to it's longevity yet. It turns on @ 38°F & off at 45°F pipe temp. I'm very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: jcewl93

customer_reviews.title: but has been doing a great job keeping the water flowing during 20 degree weather ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. What more can you ask? I'm using it off-label to keep an outdoor water hose from freezing up. So it gets warmer than designed, but has been doing a great job keeping the water flowing during 20 degree weather (20F) we've had. Ran the heater along the 5/8" hose and covered with those 6' foam insulation strips for 1" pipe. The thermostat is in free air, so the heat is on with air temps 35 to 45 degrees. When the tape is on for an extended period with no flow, the water can warm to about 70 degrees... so no fear of melting the hose at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, thermostat works as stated, nice product
customer_reviews.text: Works great, goes on about 34 degrees, as designed. I actually use this to protect cold sensitive bushes. Where I live, it almost never drops below freezing, but if it does, it will kill some magnificent bougainvillea plants. I run these through the plants, plug them in, they do nothing until it gets close to freeing, then they protect the plants. Not recommended if you regularly drop below freezing, but for the SF bay area, where it might hit freezing 2 nights per year, just right.
customer_reviews.author: R. KellyTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Extended my RV camping, protected my water line down to 17 degrees no problem
customer_reviews.text: Simple and good value, the 6 foot heater attached easily with high temp electric tape. You will need the tape to secure it every 6 inches. You will also need tin foil to wrap around plastic pipe or hose before you put it on, and you will need to wrap the whole deal with insulation, I used foam insulating tape made by Frost King. I used this on the water line from the fresh water tank to where it entered the bottom of the trailer, about a five foot run.
customer_reviews.author: SigDigitTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: If they got any more just price you better scoop them up fast.
customer_reviews.text: Getting ready to plug this outfit in probably tomorrow check it out see if it works I use it on a 50 foot water hose with aluminum tape wrapped around a water hose first then I put the heat baseball dates with black tape every 6 pitches that I covered that with one in each of the high-priced rubber insulation and 6ft lengths so hopefully I can keep running water this one or two my RV which I live in full time. Fingers crossed it is a good value of what I paid for this I couldn't Buy 10/12 ft anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Tucker

customer_reviews.title: minus 8 degrees and heating cable is a cold as ...
customer_reviews.text: minus 8 degrees and heating cable is a cold as the frozen 1" pvc pipe,, when i recieved it i test d it with the freeze,, didnt work , then it work d,, install d it,, electric supplied to the cable plug,, have to remove this cable and purchase another brand ,,, can t rely on this thing
customer_reviews.author: yy22yy44

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased it is working as advertised so far
customer_reviews.text: I installed this over PEX. First wrapped the pipe in aluminum foil, zip tied the heat tape on and the covered it with rubber tube insulation. I put it on before we got winter cold. So far, it is working and we have been in single degrees at night and below freezing during the day. I am pleased it is working as advertised so far, but still lots of winter to go.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Snipes

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: This heat tape lasted all of 2 months before it stopped working and started tripping my GFI. Instant frozen water and an almost burned out water pump. We replaced the GFI thinking it may have been worn out. Nope. Tripped as soon as you plugged the heat tape it in. Not a worn spot in sight on this tape. Replaced the GFI switch with an AFCI outlet thinking it might need more wiggle room before it tripped the outlet. Nope! This tape is garbage. Oh, and it conveniently died one week past my ‘able to return’ date. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Heat Your Pipes
customer_reviews.text: Jury's not in on this one yet. Had to replace 10 year old water pipe heat tape. Can say it was easy to install, and the power indicator connector will help give some comfort knowing it's "on", or should be ... whether the tape is working properly or not is another question. Adding insulation fiberglass water pipe tubing will help retain heat around pipe area. Plus installed TR(TW)711/NII Refrigerator Thermostat for better on/off/on/demand control of water pipe anti-freeze possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Mastropietro

customer_reviews.title: Keeping the pipes from freezing
customer_reviews.text: Been able to leave a spigot on in the freezing temperatures this winter. I usually flush water where my dog relieves herself, she burns the lawn, and didn’t want to stop as the temperatures dropped, This is working well for my needs. I was able to expose the pipe in my basement right near the exit point to the sight handle and wrapped it neatly with insulative tape. The first bit of water on a cold day is warm, so it’s working as needed. Now that the temps are below 20 degrees, I haven’t been watering. I don’t need an ice rink for a yard.
customer_reviews.author: gEoFFTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Electric heat tracing starts up at 45 degrees F
customer_reviews.text: This product was as described. I am using them as freeze protection on palm trees in the back yard and wrapped them in burlap to keep tree warm during freezes.
customer_reviews.author: Garry H

customer_reviews.title: Made RV winter water line.
customer_reviews.text: Made long winter water line for RV. Fastened this to heavy duty camco drinking water hose using electrical tape every inch or 2 (took a long time) but didn't want any bulges where it wasnt in contact with the hose. Then put the hose in foam pipe insulation. Got down to 20 degrees last night. Water flowed perfectly. The cold water was even warm for a few minutes. Was going to purchase a already made winter water line but they are so expensive and got horrible reviews so made my own. Just hope the heat tape lasts. Will update as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Y

customer_reviews.title: Great on all piping.
customer_reviews.text: By Far amazon has the best price on this stuff.. I've used it on water mains all the way up to 2 1/2" Steel. I've also ran temporary water mains on top of the snow, with this strip and foam insulation..it does the job. Please unplug every season when not in use. The thermostats are not super accurate but will be fine to prevent bursts or freeze-ups. For safety this must be on a GFI outlet and it clearly states that now!
customer_reviews.author: plumber

customer_reviews.title: Attached to Camco water hose to RV down to 15deg and has not frozen.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this on my camper here in indiana during the winter. I used electrical tape to attach to a Camco water hose and wrapped both with foam tubes the whole length. I had enough extra on a 25 ft hose to wrap a water filter at the camper inlet. It so far has been down to 15deg at night and have not had the hose freeze. I will be purchasing another shorter hose to put around the black and grey drain hoses, as I have had those freeze, I never though the black tank would freeze, but it does.
customer_reviews.author: James H.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted much longer than our Pirit hose did!
customer_reviews.text: We travel coast to coast with my husband's job as a power lineman and needed to replace a "heat tape" while we were in NJ. Apparently NJ never freezes (tongue-in-cheek comment) because we couldn't find what we needed at the local feed store, tractor supply, home improvement stores...anywhere. So I took to Amazon for help and found this. We have had this for two years and I will add that my man has had to cut this off from two different hoses and reattach/insulate to connect to our fifth wheel's water. It has kept our hose warm in -30 temps. It is still going strong and we are looking at a third winter with it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Branchal

customer_reviews.title: Heated cables were dead on arrival
customer_reviews.text: We were in an emergency to get these cables on our water line before the forecasted Icey temps come in 48 hours. we needed 2 cables ...but I read the reviews and decided to buy 3 in case maybe 1 didn't work. We tested them in GCFIoutlets. we put ice on the thermostats for 15 minutes. Only 1 out of the 3 cables got warm. We now have to buy cables...and we are not going to be ready in time for the cold weather that's coming. TEST TEST the cables...or you are installing nothing on your water line.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel.D

customer_reviews.title: Test before you install, but they work well to keep the pipes from freezing.
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my barn. They keep the exposed pipes from freezing. I did have one section last year that failed and the pipe broke, but the other sections all worked well. You can test them before installing by laying a plastic ziploc bag of ice on the thermostat. I use them taped onto pvc with electrical tape, with pipe insulation on top.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Good heat cable.
customer_reviews.text: Works great to wrap around my water drain valve on my rv. Camped in 5 deg f and it kept the fresh water 1 1/2" valve from freezing. I wrapped it around the pvc and covered with a thin layer of foam.
customer_reviews.author: Made in USA

customer_reviews.title: Worked so far...
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulty figuring out what size I needed--some reviews make suggestions, but I still wanted to see the manufacture's instructions to be sure. I've added a picture of the sizing chart from the instructions--I hope that helps the next person. The instructions were pretty straight forward and it was easy to install. It's below freezing tonight and I just checked--it's definitely generating some heat (the pipe isn't as freezing cold as everything else). We'll see in the morning if it worked as advertised. I gave it a "neutral" three stars for now and will revise once I've had it a while and see how it performs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: never worked
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heat tape to keep the underneath water of an RV warm. I spent a lot of time putting it in insulation and taping it shut. Yes I did check it prior to doing all the work underneath the RV. Wow, winter came and I froze pipes. I ended up with a space heater underneath and no problems. late summer I pulled heat tape off and realized it was not even working or heating. A lot of time , money and headache. Im just getting around to writing a review and apologize for letting others get taken from a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BIG MISTAKE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product. After installing the heating cable we had about two weeks or worry free time then I noticed that the cold water was running real HOT!! This went on for about 3 days then in the middle of the night the cord stopped working and we woke up with frozen pipes and no water!! This happened the end of January and we STILL don’t have water!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Healey

customer_reviews.title: Don't particularly like the way this one works
customer_reviews.text: Don't particularly like the way this one works. You have to run it along the pipe. I like the ones that wrap around the pipe they work much better. As a matter of fact my pipe did freeze up a bit and my washer would not run for a couple days had to run a heater to warm it all up. I think it helped some because it didn't freeze to the point of bursting but did stop the water flow because of the cold temps we had here recently. Below zero temps with windchill factor at -18.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Wiles

customer_reviews.title: This was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install, and quickly raised the temperature of near-freezing copper pipe to 40F, according to infrared thermometer. The pipe has remained at 40F according to infrared thermometer ever since, regardless of adjacent foundation wall temperature. I now sleep more easily at night. (Don't forget the GFCI!)
customer_reviews.author: B. Mord

customer_reviews.title: No frozen pipes
customer_reviews.text: Reworked my entire well system over the summer switching from an old jet pump to a submersible. Without rebuilding my well house, the result was new piping coming out of my well that is exposed to the elements. I used this on all exposed pipes. 7 degrees this winter and no freezing on exposed PVC pipes. Perfect for my situation.
customer_reviews.author: SoftwareDevJsn

customer_reviews.title: Hooked up
customer_reviews.text: Its all hooked up. Won't know if it actually works until freeze. I did wrap my hose with insulation on top of this like. Seems good quality. the plug lights up when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Eaheer

customer_reviews.title: Easy-Heat makes excellent products.
customer_reviews.text: Easy-Heat products like this outdoor water pipe heat wire to keep the water from freezing and their roof heaters to prevent ice dams are all well made and have long lives.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.

customer_reviews.title: I put the cord down the inside length of the water tubes to keep the water from freezing and my chickens happy with water
customer_reviews.text: They have been working in this cold weather we have been getting. Might quit working someday but they are working for now. I use them in my chicken coops. I put the cord down the inside length of the water tubes to keep the water from freezing and my chickens happy with water.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Mirkovich

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. Wish it came longer for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. Wish it came longer for my purposes. Has a glowing lighted plug to show it has power although there is no special indicator to show when heat is going through the wire. Made in Mexico for anyone interested in country of origin. Company website says about 7 watts per foot. It was easy to install, just get lots of electrical tape.
customer_reviews.author: RP-NYC

customer_reviews.title: Used in Rain Gutters
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to put in all my rain gutters to prevent ice build up. I must say they kept all the gutters moving water instead of freezing solid. I only plug them in when needed. They have a thermostat and will run when its cold even if there is no ice present.
customer_reviews.author: BQ

customer_reviews.title: Good product, fairly easy install, some design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install but I wish the thermometer could be moved out was located more toward the middle of the heating coil. They recommend having the thermometer wrapped but then place it at the end where the plug was which made it extend difficult to wrap and still reach the outlet. I can't attest to effectiveness till after winter but so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Kristin M

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect and saved me from a frozen busted pump and tank like last year
customer_reviews.text: Stopped my pump and pressure tank from freezing this past winter. My pump is mounted on top of a 5gal pressure tank so I wrapped this around the tank first(the plug end), then around the pump housing on the pump while the rest was taped to the inlet hose to the creek above ground, then pipe insulation from lowes put over it and taped to keep the slit closed to keep the heat from the tape escaping. My water never froze all winter with single digit temps at night.
customer_reviews.author: Frybry

customer_reviews.title: No freezing water
customer_reviews.text: We used this because we were in our RV in Iowa durning winter. This works great! Not once did our water hose freeze. However, this is not the only thing we had on our water hose. So you still have to wrap it up.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Doest work after a month
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a month and as soon as it got cold nothing. It still lights up, but does not heat. They are sending me a replacement. Thanks amazon. Hopefully I get more use out of this one. But I will have to replace the tape i spent 30$ on.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Ours didn’t work others might
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for us at all. The pipe froze even after following the instructions. Maybe ours was just defective so we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: MBeed

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm to keep the dog water thawed out.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for keeping the dog water thawed out when it gets cold. Then my new puppy chewed the end off of it and it stopped working. Will replace it and rap it in something she cant chew through. :D I will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: TheSquatch

customer_reviews.title: Easy install & solved a huge problem with my tankless water heater
customer_reviews.text: Super easy installation. I was having trouble with my tankless water heater (installed in the attic) throwing trouble codes because the incoming water was too cold. I installed this immediately below the unit and so far the water heater has been running perfectly. Super cheap and easy solution to a potentially big problem.
customer_reviews.author: T. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Works great and simple to install. I purchased this as our pipes kept freezing for our kitchen sink and dishwasher, both hot and cold lines. You can only use one unit per pipe, you cannot put part on one pipe, have an exposed section, then continue to another pipe. I originally wanted to do this to cover both hot and cold lines for my kitchen, but the instructions said that was a fire hazard. Works well, once installed, no more freezing pipes on 0 degree days!!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Rokosz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Finally a long enough heat tape. Easy to install works to keep my water pipes from freezing last year i wasnt so lucky.
customer_reviews.author: hanibal16

customer_reviews.title: only had it for a short time, but in the past this brand and style have worked very well for me
customer_reviews.text: i had one of these for years at my old house in my garage so i could have my hot/cold outlets available year round. this time i have it running to the supplies for a work sink in another house's garage. seems to work just fine. my last one lasted for years. we'll see how this one does.
customer_reviews.author: Jared M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Just what was needed
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mitsubishi split system and the condenser outside has icing problems during snowstorms. this heat cable is inserted at the bottom of the housing to keep ice buildup from freezing and bursting the coil, which has already happened once from neglect on the part of the installer. although they did replace the unit at no charge since they failed to explain the icing problem when the unit was originally installed.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the lime tree warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this heating cable to keep a lime tree from 'freezing', yes it is not what the cable is meant to do, but it does a great job at keeping the lime tree from getting too cold. Normally, I would cover the tree with a sheet, but with the heating cable, the heat turns on and off automatically. The cable is durable and definitely an easy to use device.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: ... distance to cover from our faucet and it worked great
customer_reviews.text: we had a lot of distance to cover from our faucet and it worked great thanks

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 of these to go around 2 water ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to go around 2 water pipes going out of the wall in my Wisconsin basement. We had a hard freeze before I installed these and we didn't have water in an upstairs bathroom. Ever since I installed these 2 years ago, we haven't had frozen pipes since. I just unplug them from the power strip during the spring when there is no chance of freezing.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and no concerns about running water when ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly through the winter. First time in years the outside pipe didn’t freeze up. Easy to install and no concerns about running water when it gets below freezing anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Montana

customer_reviews.title: Held up well in 0 degree weather in Ohio this ...
customer_reviews.text: Held up well in 0 degree weather in Ohio this year! Wrapped the hose in Aluminum foil, Attached the heat tape with electrical tape every about 16-18in, then wrapped pipe insulation around it fastened with duct tape. Never doubled up the tape, or coiled it. Kept the horses automatic waterier flowing!

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality heating cables. They worked well as extra protection from the elements from some small pipes on an interior wall that was not insulated as well as it should have been. Fast shipping as well.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a lot less expensive than the dish deicers ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep snow off my satellite dish and applied it with 2 1/2" aluminum cold weather tape in a coil pattern. Works great and a lot less expensive than the dish deicers I found.

customer_reviews.title: keep water from freezing

customer_reviews.text: Amazing. It is really funny because on nights when it is freezing the cold water is warm. So glad we are not having a frozen water line.

customer_reviews.text: The price on this is amazing compared to buying local and it works as it should. No more frozen water for us.

customer_reviews.title: Was as described, as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Was as described, as expected. I use this short one for protecting the water pipe where it comes out of the ground and into my house. I like that the plug has a light in it so you can see at a glance that it has power.

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: As expected. Was easy to wrap around a hose and secure with pipe insulation. Kept the house to our travel trailer from freezing up. This was the lowest cost heat tape I could find and I am very satisfied. I appreciated the lighted plug that let me know it always had power.

customer_reviews.title: I love these bottles!!
customer_reviews.text: Wish there was someone to contact...I have bought 17 of these and 2 of them the clamps broke....be very gentle with the clamps! Also out of 17 only two dripped...pulled them apart...shaved a couple bumps, put together and no worries!!

customer_reviews.title: great for keeping plants warm
customer_reviews.text: I use this to heat plumerias in a green house in Southern California. It has worked fine for two winters (although it hasn't come on so far this winter (2014). It comes on when the temperature reaches 38 degrees Fahrenheit (preset, not adjustable). I put the sensor end outside of the green house so the plants don't actually get that cold.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my RV hose.
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my RV hose line. I bought a heavy duty water supply line, wrapped it in foil tape, then secured the heat tape to the hose, and finally wrapped everything in foam insulation. It has kept the water flowing at temperatures down to 20F.
customer_reviews.author: BofNC

customer_reviews.title: Helped out in Chicago's Snowpocalypse
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pipe that bursts like clockwork everytime we get sustained temperatures below zero for a number of days. Plug indicator light assures the system has power
Plugs into a standard 120 VAC outlet
Constructed of weather resistant PVC outer jacket, continuous ground braid and polyethylene inner insulation
